alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Palm Beach County; Metro Broward County; Metro Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Collier, southeastern Hendry, Broward and southwestern Palm Beach Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a funnel cloud along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Hendry Correctional to 6 miles southeast of Miccosukee Service Plaza to East Toll Gate On Alligator Alley. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pembroke Pines, Coral Springs, Sunrise, Tamarac, Margate, Weston, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Mission Bay, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Hendry Correctional, Holey Land Wildlife Refuge, Whisper Walk, Miccosukee Indian Reservation, Godfrey Road, Rotenberger Wildlife Refuge, Intersection I-75 And U.S. 27, Miccosukee Service Plaza, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley and Big Cypress Seminole Reservation. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons participating in outdoor activities should seek sturdy shelter until these storms pass. Open shelters found in parks, beaches, or golf courses offer no protection from the dangers of lightning.
